title: Merge Sort and Divide and Conquer
description: A 60-second lesson on Merge Sort and Divide and Conquer.

hook.text: Sorting a thousand items is hard. Sorting two items is trivial. Merge sort exploits this gap.

buildup.text: It splits the list in half, sorts each half, then merges the sorted halves back together.

discovery.text: This divide-and-conquer approach runs in O(n log n) â€” vastly faster than O(nÂ²) on large data.

twist.text: Merge sort needs extra memory to hold the temporary halves. Speed costs space.

climax.text: It's guaranteed O(n log n) in every case. No tricky inputs can slow it down.
